link.script: /* CSS Browser Selector v0.4.0 (Nov 02, 2010) Can apply styles to specific browsers, this js adds a class to body tag based on browser Rafael Lima (http://rafael.adm.br) http://rafael.adm.br/css_browser_selector License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/ Contributors: http://rafael.adm.br/css_browser_selector#contributors */ function css_browser_selector(u) { var ua = u.toLowerCase(), is = function (t) { return ua.indexOf(t) > -1 }, g = 'gecko', w = 'webkit', s = 'safari', o = 'opera', m = 'mobile', h = document.documentElement, b = [(!(/opera|webtv/i.test(ua)) && /msie\s(\d)/.test(ua)) ? ('ie ie' + RegExp.$1) : is('firefox/2') ? g + ' ff2' : is('firefox/3.5') ? g + ' ff3 ff3_5' : is('firefox/3.6') ? g + ' ff3 ff3_6' : is('firefox/3') ? g + ' ff3' : is('gecko/') ? g : is('opera') ? o + (/version\/(\d+)/.test(ua) ? ' ' + o + RegExp.$1 : (/opera(\s|\/)(\d+)/.test(ua) ? ' ' + o + RegExp.$2 : '')) : is('konqueror') ? 'konqueror' : is('blackberry') ? m + ' blackberry' : is('android') ? m + ' android' : is('chrome') ? w + ' chrome' : is('iron') ? w + ' iron' : is('applewebkit/') ? w + ' ' + s + (/version\/(\d+)/.test(ua) ? ' ' + s + RegExp.$1 : '') : is('mozilla/') ? g : '', is('j2me') ? m + ' j2me' : is('iphone') ? m + ' iphone' : is('ipod') ? m + ' ipod' : is('ipad') ? m + ' ipad' : is('mac') ? 'mac' : is('darwin') ? 'mac' : is('webtv') ? 'webtv' : is('win') ? 'win' + (is('windows nt 6.0') ? ' vista' : '') : is('freebsd') ? 'freebsd' : (is('x11') || is('linux')) ? 'linux' : '', 'js']; c = b.join(' '); h.className += ' ' + c; return c; }; css_browser_selector(navigator.userAgent);

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: The Owego Apalachin Central School District is CLOSED through May 15, 2020 by executive order of the Governor of New York.
We will continue to update information as it becomes available here on our website and through the OACSD mobile app. Limited information will be shared on our social media pages.
View OA Remote Learning Plan here:
Next Board of Education Meeting will be Monday, April 27th at 6:30pm. BOE meetings will continue to be live streamed on our
and shared on the BOE page after here:

p.span: Please note the following information during our extended school closure (Updated 4/27/20).
Closure Update:

span.style: font-size: 11pt;font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Our buildings are officially closed through May 15th.
By
, the governor has directed all schools statewide to remain closed through May 15, 2020, at which time the closure will be re-evaluated.

will continue during this time of our buildings being closed. We will continue to work with local emergency management staff, the Tioga County Health Department, the County Executive, the State Education Department, and ultimately the Governor’s office to determine our status for remaining closed with remote learning or opening our buildings moving forward.

Use of playgrounds, fields, and other facilities: You may have noticed signs up around our school grounds, fields, and playgrounds regarding them being ‘closed’. Per NYS and Tioga County Executive order, we were instructed to close all sites until further notice.
Food Distribution:
In an effort to limit contact and reduce families and staff having to come out daily, meal
grab-n-go pick
up will be on
Mondays
and
Thursdays ONLY
, from
10am-1pm
and
4pm-6pm
in the OES Loop and the Apalachin Fire Station. Families will receive meals to last them multiple days. If transportation is an issue, please call us at
and leave a message requesting delivery. Our website will always show the most updated meal options.
***At this time we will NOT be offering Friday bus drops anymore.***
Online Academic Plan:

The focus of the Remote Learning Plan, that officially started on April 20th, is on the continuation of student learning and to minimize any negative impact the current circumstances have on students academically and personally. This set of guidelines is designed to support an understanding of the district expectations for learning and grading at both the elementary and secondary levels.
The specific elements of our instructional approach, such as learning platforms, modes of student contact, and student learning time, vary according to grade level. Review the ‘

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

a.span: OA Remote Learning Guide during COVID-19

p.span: ’ on our Curriculum and Instruction page for more information on what you can expect to see for your child(ren).
Reach out to your teacher(s) or your building principal with any questions regarding the new structure.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline
font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline
font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Testing:
We have been informed that 3-8 testing and Regents exams for June and August have been canceled:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: . We have received word from the College Board on arrangements that are being made to provide remote testing opportunities for
. Here is a link to all of the information:
p.a: AP COVID-19 Updates for Owego Free Academy
p.span: . SATs have been canceled for May and June. Collegeboard is putting together a new testing schedule, to be released in May, that will include test administration every month September-December next school year. ACTs canceled for April, no decision on June test as of now. (***Many colleges/universities are going "test optional" for next year's admissions cycle: meaning a student can apply not having a set of scores. A decision will be based upon academic record and letters of recommendation.***)
WIFI Information:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Board of Education:
The next BOE Meeting will be Monday, April 27th at 6:30pm. BOE meetings will continue to be live streamed on our

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: . More BOE info and videos of past meetings can be found here

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt;font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: The upcoming school budget vote and board of education elections have been delayed until at least June 1st. We expect to receive more guidance and information over the coming weeks.
OACSD Help Line:
We have a dedicated phone number

to leave a message for any questions you might have during the extended time away. With district staff working off-site during the duration of the closure the best way to contact them would be through their district email account or by leaving a message on this dedicated number. (Messages will be forwarded to the appropriate district personnel.) Thank you for your patience and understanding as responses could be delayed.
Free/Reduced Meals:
Sign up for free and reduced school meals by applying online at

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: . Free and reduced meals would be available for your child(ren) for the remainder of the school year and 30 business days into next school year.
SNAP Benefits:
If you are a family that is in need of extra assistance you can also apply for SNAP benefits at

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: . The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) issues electronic benefits that can be used like cash to purchase food at stores.
Health Insurance:
NY State of Health is committed to ensuring access to affordable, quality health insurance for all New Yorkers so they can get the care they need during this state of emergency. Find out more here:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

a.span: NY STATE OF HEALTH LETTER TO FAMILIES

p.span: OACSD Information will continue to come directly to you on the district mobile app (download for FREE in your app store), website, and through our SchoolMessenger System.

SchoolMessenger sends updates to the Parent/Guardian contact that is currently on file with the district. This includes emails, texts messages and phone calls. If you have not been receiving any of these updates, please contact us for help. Please note that limited information will be posted on the district’s social media sites. This is to ensure that all messages reaching our school community are accurate and that all information comes directly from the school district.

Finally, it can’t be said enough times, we hope you and your family stay healthy and we are here for you. Please participate in “flattening the curve.” Social distance is essential. Stay home and away from others. We’ll all be better for it.
We will get through this together and that’s what makes our OA community special. Thank you again for your understanding and support.
#OATogether

div.span: Address: 5 Sheldon Guile Boulevard, Owego, NY 13827 | Phone: (607) 687-7307
